sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Groff packages contains the addftinfo, afmtodit, eqn, grodvi, groff, grog, grohtml, grolj4, grops, grotty, hpftodit, indxbib, lkbib, lookbib, neqn, nroff, pfbtops, pic, psbb, refer, soelim, tbl, tfmtodit and troff programs.

sect3.title: addftinfo
sect3.para: addftinfo reads a troff font file and adds some additional font-metric information that is used by the groff system.

sect3.title: afmtodit
sect3.para: afmtodit creates a font file for use with groff and grops.

sect3.title: eqn
sect3.para: eqn compiles descriptions of equations embedded within troff input files into commands that are understood by troff.

sect3.title: grodvi
sect3.para: grodvi is a driver for groff that produces TeX dvi format.

sect3.title: groff
sect3.para: groff is a front-end to the groff document formatting system. Normally it runs the troff program and a post-processor appropriate for the selected device.

sect3.title: grog
sect3.para: grog reads files and guesses which of the groff options -e, -man, -me, -mm, -ms, -p, -s, and -t are required for printing files, and prints the groff command including those options on the standard output.

sect3.title: grohtml
sect3.para: grohtml translates the output of GNU troff to html

sect3.title: grolj4
sect3.para: grolj4 is a driver for groff that produces output in PCL5 format suitable for an HP Laserjet 4 printer.

sect3.title: grops
sect3.para: grops translates the output of GNU troff to Postscript.

sect3.title: grotty
sect3.para: grotty translates the output of GNU troff into a form suitable for typewriter-like devices.

sect3.title: hpftodit
sect3.para: hpftodit creates a font file for use with groff -Tlj4 from an HP tagged font metric file.

sect3.title: indxbib
sect3.para: indxbib makes an inverted index for the bibliographic databases a specified file for use with refer, lookbib, and lkbib.

sect3.title: lkbib
sect3.para: lkbib searches bibliographic databases for references that contain specified keys and prints any references found on the standard output.

sect3.title: lookbib
sect3.para: lookbib prints a prompt on the standard error (unless the standard input is not a terminal), reads from the standard input a line containing a set of keywords, searches the bibliographic databases in a specified file for references containing those keywords, prints any references found on the standard output, and repeats this process until the end of input.

sect3.title: neqn
sect3.para: The neqn script formats equations for ascii output.

sect3.title: nroff
sect3.para: The nroff script emulates the nroff command using groff.

sect3.title: pfbtops
sect3.para: pfbtops translates a Postscript font in .pfb format to ASCII.

sect3.title: pic
sect3.para: pic compiles descriptions of pictures embedded within troff or TeX input files into commands that are understood by TeX or troff.

sect3.title: psbb
sect3.para: psbb reads a file which should be a Postscript document conforming to the Document Structuring conventions and looks for a %%BoundingBox comment.

sect3.title: refer
sect3.para: refer copies the contents of a file to the standard output, except that lines between .[ and .] are interpreted as citations, and lines between .R1 and .R2 are interpreted as commands about how citations are to be processed.

sect3.title: soelim
sect3.para: soelim reads files and replaces lines of the form .so file by the contents of file.

sect3.title: tbl
sect3.para: tbl compiles descriptions of tables embedded within troff input files into commands that are understood by troff.

sect3.title: tfmtodit
sect3.para: tfmtodit creates a font file for use with groff -Tdvi

sect3.title: troff
sect3.para: troff is highly compatible with Unix troff. Usually it should be invoked using the groff command, which will also run preprocessors and post-processors in the appropriate order and with the appropriate options.
